Boston.com
10

US Senate defeats bill to reverse birth control rule

The 51-48 vote today killed a measure to allow employers and insurers to deny coverage of health care based on moral or religious objections. (Globe, 1:44 p.m.)
  • Ex-Boston mayor backs Brown on 'conscience exemption'

In N.H., Obama backs his energy policy

President Obama fired back at criticism over rising gas prices and said his administration has helped decrease foreign oil dependency. (Boston Globe, 2:34 p.m.)

Ex-teacher in court on child sex charges

Bail set at $100,000 for ex-Newton teacher

Ex-Newton teacher David Ettlinger pleaded not guilty today to charges that he sexually assaulted two children, posed them nude, and videotaped them. (Globe, 11:14 a.m.)

Photos: Jason Varitek through the years

The catcher, who has played his entire major-league career with the Red Sox since his debut in 1997, will announce his retirement today.

Weather Wisdom Blog

Rain changing to snow across area

Colder air is now moving into the area at the same time one last shot of precipitation is moving east, meteorologist Dave Epstein writes.  Forecast (3:02 p.m.)

Twitter gives Boston police account info

Twitter has handed over information for some accounts tied to Occupy Boston, ending a court battle as local law enforcement investigated hacking. (Globe, 3:17 p.m.)

News

Pre-dawn storms turn deadly

Overnight storms raked the nation's midsection, killing at least 12 people in three states. At least 16 tornadoes were reported from Nebraska, Kansas, Missouri, Illinois, and Kentucky.

Politics

Romney wins non-binding caucuses in Wyoming

Mitt Romney has won the GOP caucuses in Wyoming – held in each of the state's counties between Feb. 9 and Feb. 29, with Romney besting Rick Santorum by seven points.

Business

A look at Google's privacy policy

Google has begun integrating all the information it collects about users into a single privacy policy. This is raising concerns among privacy advocates and shrugs from people who prefer the convenience over their personal data.
